problem.p: Which of the following statements are correct, according to Newton's 2nd law?

optionresponse.p: For each object, vectors \(F_{net}\) and \(a\) have the same direction.
The velocity of an object is directly proportional to the magnitude of the net force acting on the object.
The velocity of an object is inversely proportional to the mass of the object.
If more than two forces are applied to an object, its speed must be changing.
If more than two forces are applied to an object, its velocity must be changing.
If exactly two forces are applied to an object, its speed must be changing.
If exactly two forces are applied to an object, its velocity must be changing.
If exactly one force is applied to an object, its speed must be increasing.
If exactly one force is applied to an object, its speed must be decreasing.
